Nanti de 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, Lassina dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. 
Lassina compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2  grosses caisses de différentes sortes de pièces détachées pour motos auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et à crédit au marché de Fakola à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Lassina espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1986 in Kadiana, Lassina lives with his 5 children and their mother in a traditional family environment, in Fakola. Not having had the opportunity to pursue his studies, Lassina quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, most notably fixing bicycles and motorbikes, and selling bike spare parts. He is held in high regard and much sought-out in Fakola and the surrounding area.

With 3 years experience in his job and searching for additional financial resources, Lassina decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, and is on his first loan with the institution. He plans to use the money to buy 2 large boxes of assorted spare parts for motorbikes from the wholesalers in Bamako. He makes his sales, for cash or credit, at the market in Fakola to a customer base composed of men and women. Lassina hopes to make a monthly profit of 200 000 francs, with which he will take care of his family's needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, 25 years old, lives with his parents in Taiz, Yemen. He has a grocery store. He is well known and has many customers. He is a hard-working and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead. He likes to stay ahead of the competition. He thinks the harder you work, the greater your reward will be. He wants to see his business grow and be an absolute success. It is for this reason that he has decided to request a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy soft drinks and canned beans for his business. 

Hussein knows that in this way he will be able to provide his household with a better economic situation. He hopes to get married and build a house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned beans for his business

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is a doctor who studied pharmacology science at Ibb University. 

He has been operating a pharmacy for five years. He resells medicines for a more profitable price in his home city.
 
He started his business by collecting a small amount of capital gradually while he was working in a hospital. He has attracted many clients due to his being a professional in his field.

Due to the bad situation in Yemen, he faced a financial challenge in his demand. So he took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back. 

In the future, Ameen would like to expand his business to open another pharmacy.

loans.use: to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back.

loans.name: Fwzy

texts.en:
Fwzy is a 28-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a bachelor's degree and has been running a small water desalination plant. He is very hard-working and he has been doing this work for six months. 

His business is easily accessible by his customers and this means it is much frequented. Thanks to the earnings he receives, he has been able to provide for his family's needs. 

He is asking for a youth loan of 80,000 YER to buy many large, empty bottles for water to supply his customers' needs. He hopes to study for his master's degree and get married.

loans.use: to buy many large empty bottles for water.

loans.name: Mrwan

texts.en:
Mrwan is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a barber shop for two years. He opened his own barber shop and it was a good step forward for proving himself and improving his living. 

He is hard-working and would like to buy barber materials but he doesn`t have sufficient money. It is for this reason that he has applied for a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy mirrors, creams and lamps for his business. 

Mrwan hopes to expand his business as much as he can to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, creams and lamps for his business.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is 30 years old. He is married with three children who live together in Ibb, Yemen. His business is tire repair and oil changes and he has employed one person in his shop. His business is located in a strategic place. He says that his shop is the primary means he has to give his family everything they need for a dignified life without hardship. Due to the bad situation in Yemen, he doesn't have money to his business items, etc. Rashid requests a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary to run the tire shop. In the future, he plans to rent another shop and open a mechanic workshop.

loans.use: to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary for his business.

loans.name: Al-Haba Group

texts.en:
AL-HABA Group is made up of four women, Soad, Raja, Jameela and another Soad who live in the same neighborhood in Hodiedah, Yemen. They requested a loan of 100,000 YER as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. 

Raja is 36 years old, a widow with one daughter who attends school. She lives with her daughter in Hodiedah. She has been operating an incense sales business for fourteen years. (She is the woman who is holding a box of incense in her right hand.) She started her business when her husband died. This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. 

Raja requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense and perfumes for resale. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing payment of school fees. In the future, Raja plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more incense and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is a very hardworking man who is very responsible with his daily activity. He’s 27 years old and lives with his parents in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a pharmacy that allows him to meet household expenses. This is his only source of income. He has attracted more clients due to his being a professional in his field. He resells medicines for a more profitable price in his home city. 

Because of this, he would like to expand his business, Bashir took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy medicines which are what he needs in his store and what customers are requesting. With this process, he will expand his clientele and his sales and thus his income. 

Bashir dreams of having a large locale for his products and building a house for himself.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his business

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is 30 years old, a married man, and has three children who live together with him in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store. Most of the people who visit the store know Yasser because he always has what his customers need at affordable prices and with good quality.

Yasser is a visionary, always searching for ways to succeed and remain active to be able to reach his future goals. He believes that reaching the top does not imply winning over everyone else, it means winning against oneself. It’s here that he decided to request a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items like sugar, beans, eggs and soft drinks. With the aim of increasing his earnings, Yasser is certain that he will be able to give his family a good life this way.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like sugar, beans, eggs and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Maria Florence

texts.en:
Maria Florence is forty-eight years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Maria Florence has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon to sell.

Maria Florence has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria Florence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Keat

texts.en:
Keat is 43 years old and married with four single children. She lives with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who especially grows rice with great help from her husband. For more income, Keat built a small wooden piggery to raise some piglets at home. This micro-business earns her a suitable income after 3-5 months of fattening pigs. Another part of the family’s main income is provided by her husband who is dedicated to a firewood-selling business.

Keat would like to request a loan to purchase an additional buffalo to help with work on the farm and for hauling the firewood trailer. She hopes that she will be able to improve her living standard in the next few years, as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo to help with work on the farm and for hauling the firewood trailer.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en:
Alejo is married with five children. Alejo is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community member to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years and every month he earns 3,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Alejo been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Alejo hopes to see his children finish their studies and to gain double the income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Laxita

texts.en:
Laxita is from Bagakay, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Laxita is widowed and has four children. To make a living, Laxita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. 

Laxita has been engaged in her business for three years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Laxita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Laxita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is married and has a child. She is 46 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Catalina owns and operates a plot of farm land, where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns 1,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Catalina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 2 years. In the future, Catalina's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma has been engaged in a hog-raising business for three years. Gemma is 44 years old and married to Manayon with four grown children. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy sack feed and an additional piglet to expand her hog-raising business. She dreams someday that her business turns into big business.

loans.use: to buy sack feed and a piglet for her business

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Filomina is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Filomina owns and operates a retail business venture. Filomina has been in her business for 2 years and earns 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

Filomina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more stock to sell such as soaps, milk, etc.. In 2011, Filomina joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as soaps, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, a 34-year-old married mother of three, has been raising hogs for six years, earning about PHP 2,000 a month. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase vitamins and hog feed to ensure profitable future sales. Jessie hopes to expand her business so that she can better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is from Pouk district, located in Siem Reap province. She was born and grew up there. She is twenty-nine years old and married with three single children who are attending school. She works as a local rice farmer and takes some time at home to weave bamboo baskets to help her husband generate income for the family. She has been active in the two businesses for many years.

With the amount she requested from HKL, Run wants to buy construction supplies to fix her house partially as it needs to be repaired before the rainy season arrives or it will suffer from the rain. She feels very happy to receive these funds to renovate her house and make it a suitable shelter.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to partially fix her house.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-seven years old. Roberta is married and has two children. To make a living, Roberta raises crops, primarily bananas, for sale. Roberta has been in her business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Roberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Roberta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married. She is thirty-eight years old and lives in the Panta-on, Ozamis City. Elvira is a farmer and she operates a banana production farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years and every month she earn PHP 3,000 from this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Elvira has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: kossiwa est une femme de 40ans. Elle est mariée un pasteur et a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. L’ainé a 05ans et le dernier 03ans. Elle est revendeuse de poissons fumés, séchés et des piments à la maison et de façon ambulante. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des piments, des poissons fumés et séchés. Elle veut subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, avoir une place dans un marché de la place et s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is 40 years old. She is married to a pastor and has two children, one of whom goes to school. Her children are 5 and 3 years old. 

Kossiwa sells dried and smoked fish, as well as pepper, from her home and on foot. This is her second loan with WAGES, and she is requesting this loan to buy pepper, and dried and smoked fish. Kossiwa wants to help meet her family's needs, to have a space in the market, and to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg is a 47-year-old widow and lives with her two daughters, ages 22 and 25, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her youngest daughter is a student while her oldest daughter helps with her business. 

Enkhtsetseg supports her family by operating a shoe retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with help from her elder daughter. When she first began her business in 2002, Enkhtsetseg was a contracted seller of a local shoe factory and she didn't have her own working capital. As a result of her hard work, today she has 4.5 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at her stall. During the past 10 years, she has gained a lot of experience and she has been able to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase shoes and gloves for spring.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and gloves for spring

loans.name: Sherwin Oliver

texts.en:
Sherwin Oliver offers transportation services to his co-villagers. He is 32 years old and married to Janet who is a high school teacher in their town. According to him, the main source of their income comes from the salary of his wife. So, as the head of the family, he needs to work out his transportation business to further help his wife in obtaining success in life. Sherwin Oliver is thankful because he is blessed with three young children.

Sherwin Oliver has operated his motorcycle transport service for over 14 years and earns approximately P3,000.The income from his transportation services business is used for their basic needs and household expenses. Aside from his transportation business, he is also engaged in farming particularly, growing corn. He has been doing his best to provide his family a better way of living and save some amount for the preparation of his children's education.

Sherwin Oliver would like to borrow an amount of P10,000 which will be used for repair of his side car. He believes that this loan will really be of great help to him so he can cover their daily needs and educate all his children.

loans.use: to repair the side car of his motorcycle transport vehicle

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza is married and has two children. She is 27 years old and resides at Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. Mariza cultivates corn to earn a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2009, Mariza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Mariza wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena has been engaged in a hog-raising business for one year. She is married with two grown-up children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and additional piglets so she can earn additional income to be able to cover the needs of her family. In the future she hope that her business will expand to support her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Hog raising is the main source of income for Rodolfo's family. He is 53 years old, married with six children. At his age, he needs to double his hard work in order to send his three children in school and provide their basic needs.

Rodolfo plans to buy four piglets and livestock feed but the income generated from his business is no longer enough, due to the increase of their daily expenses. With this in mind, he is asking for a loan amounting to P30,000. He hopes to receive this loan amount in order to improve his business which enables him to improve their way of living and support his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and four piglets to be raised

loans.name: Janely

texts.en:
Janely is married and has two children. She is 20 years old and resides at Prenza, Tangub City, Philippines. Janely operates a family member's business where they plant, harvest and sell bananas for their living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Janely joined GDMPC. In the future, Janely wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is fifty-three years old. She has seven children. Lucia is a widow. She says that being single parent is very difficult but she still tries her best to meet her family's daily needs. She uses her income to pay the electricity bill and to meet her family's daily needs.

Due to high cost of basic commodities, Lucia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fish such as milk fish and tilapia to sell. Lucia hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fish such as milk fish and tilapia to sell.

loans.name: Petronela

texts.en:
Petronela is aged 43 and is married to Lazarus, a 53-year-old man. They have six children who are under 22 years of age. They are: Bernabas, Desi, Ace, Andarias, Mathias and Helin. Some of them are working and some are still attending school. In order to meet the needs of her family, Petronela has been running a kiosk business for 5 years. She sells daily basic needs, i.e., detergent, instant noodle, bath soap, betel vine and fried treats (donuts and fried bananas). She works for the business for 14 hours a day while taking care of her family. 

As a mother of six children, Petronela works hard to supply the everyday needs of her family including the education costs of her children. Petronela is thinking of running a motor taxi business, therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She would like to spend the money on a second-hand motorcycle and stock for the kiosk, e.g., sugar, coffee, tea bags, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle and stock for the kiosk, e.g., sugar, coffee, tea bags, etc.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 44 years old. She is engaged in a "buying and selling" business. Her husband's name is Juanito, and he is a farmer in the village of Rang-ay. Sometimes he helps her to sell in the local community. Julie has seven children; some of them are currently going to school.

Julie wants to continue sending her children to school and to buy more products to sell. In this regard, Julie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy meat, fish and vegetables to resell. She believes that she can improve her business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to provide the needs of her family. She runs a sari-sari  (variety) store and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan to buy grocery items like snacks, bread, cooking oil and soft drinks. She has been running the general store for six years and is very happy about the improvement of their living situation that has occurred. 

In the future, Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like snacks, bread, cooking oil and soft drinks

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old, married and has two children. For five years, he has made a living by providing transportation services and earns about 6,000 PHP a month from his work. 

In 2009, Severino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his vehicle so he can provide better service to his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle so he can provide better service to his customers

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas, age 55, makes a living in the farming business in Kompong Cham province. She owns a small piece of farmland and the rice production that is collected from the harvest is not enough to satisfy the family’s needs. Therefore, Meas normally rents additional farmland from others villagers to deal with her situation. Presently, Meas has become a single parent and lives with only one son who works as a construction worker.

So now, Meas decided to look for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to add to her savings to purchase a plot of farmland to grow her business. For her prospect, Meas wants to further expand her business and make her livelihood sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland to grow her farming business.

loans.name: Kondo

texts.fr:
Kondo est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 7 ans.
Kondo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des céréales, du bois de chauffe et des tubercules d’igname pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kondo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des tubercules d’igname et du bois de chauffe. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner une partie.
Dans les prochaines années, Kondo voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer les besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kondo is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a retired man. She has two children who are both in school. The eldest child is ten years old, and the youngest is seven. Kondo has been working as a retailer since 2005. She sells grains, firewood, and yam tubers from home to a wide range of clients. She buys her products in Lomé. She works on her own. For the time being, her biggest problem is not having enough goods in stock.

Kondo has asked for a second loan from WAGES in order to buy grains, yams tubers, and firewood. She wants to reinvest in her business and save a portion of it.

In the coming years, Kondo would like to grow her business. She says that she plans to cover her family's basic needs with the profit that she earns.

loans.use: to buy grains, yams, and make the local drink

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Buying and selling fish is Gloria's primary source of income. Gloria is 38 years old and is married. She lives with her family in the village of Rang-ay. At this time, Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy different kinds of fish such as milk fish and "tilapia" to sell in the village. This business helps Gloria because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish such as milk fish and "tilapia" to sell in the village

loans.name: Sokhearn

texts.en: Sokhearn, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a truck driver who earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her two children are employed by a rubber plantation. They earn about USD 10 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation situation, Sokhearn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she has been involved in buying and selling fish for over ten years and earns approximately PHP 300 daily.

According to Theresa, through the income generated from her business she had been able to give daily allowances to her children who are in school. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia and milk fish. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish, such as tilapia and milk fish

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 34, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a sanitation worker who earns about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. He earns about USD 3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kim is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase rice to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, she would earn extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house to provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell for a profitable price.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino Bardales tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad ellos ya son independientes y trabajan, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Hace 2 años Don Florentino se dedica a la compra y venta de recolección de chatarra para reciclaje. Su negocio funciona recolectando cualquier tipo de metal en mal estado, cartón, plástico, prensa etc. El lo compra a un precio accesible y después los vende por libra a las Empresas dedicadas al reciclaje. Dice que en este negocio le ha ido bien y que es rentable  porque de allí ha podido sostener a su familia.   El dedica 3 días por semana a esta actividad.
El solicita su segundo préstamo de 8,000 lempiras para comprar metales y plástico para reciclaje, con esta inversión el podrá obtener mejores ganancias para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Florentino Bardales, age 43, is married and has two children, ages 18 and 19.  The children are independent, and they work.  He lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

For two years Florentino has been buying and selling junk to recycle.  His business functions by collecting any type of metal that is not in good shape, cartons, plastics, and newspapers, etc.  He buys them for an affordable price, and he later sells them buy the pound to recycling companies.

He says that this business has gone well for him.  It is profitable because the business is how he has been able to support his family.  He works three days a week on this business activity.

He is requesting his second loan, and he is asking for 8,000 lempiras to buy metals and plastics to recycle.  With this investment he will be able to get better income to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy metals and plastics to sell to recycling companies.

loans.name: Raul Fabian

texts.es:
Raúl es un hombre de 38 años que vive con su esposa y 2 hijos (de 12 y 10 años) en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos de "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Raúl trabaja de guardia durante en día y además, en la finca donde vive y con la ayuda de su esposa crían ganado para luego comerciarlo. Este emprendedor desea comprar más ganado y de esta manera al venderlo obtener mayores ganancias. Su jornada diaria es dura, lo más difícil es limpiar los potreros donde tiene a sus animales según nos comenta. Este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre la comunidad de KIVA y Raúl. La evaluación crediticia ha determinado que Raúl tiene bajo riesgo de incurrir en mora, además no solamente se le entregará el dinero que necesita sino también que se le brindará asesoría y capacitación de tal manera que pueda hacer de su inversión lo más provechosa posible.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos terminando sus carreras estudiantiles para que puedan tener un mejor porvenir, y espera que con este crédito y con mayores ingresos estar más cerca de cumplirlo.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 38 year old man who lives with his wife and their two children (12 and 10 years old). They live in “San Miguel de Los Bancos", a rural canton in the Pichincha province where Ecuador’s capital is located. One of the primary resources in “Los Bancos” is the water, since in this area, there are an endless number of streams and small springs that run into considerable sized rivers. This canton has a large commercial movement that has developed on the main street where you can find hotels, restaurants and grocery stores. There are especially a lot of agricultural products as well as veterinary services and stores that serve the daily needs of the population.

 Raúl works as a guard during the day. In addition, on the farm where he lives, with the help of his wife, he raises livestock to later sell them. This entrepreneur wants to buy more livestock to sell in order to earn larger profits. His daily work is difficult. The most difficult part is cleaning the pastures where he keeps his animals, according to him. This is first loan with Fundación Alternativa which is the intermediary between Kiva and Raúl. The credit evaluation determined that Raúl has a low risk of default. In addition, the institution not only will provide money that he needs but it will also offer consulting and training in a way that lets him make the most profitable investments possible.

His dream is to see his children finish their studies so that they can have a better life. He hopes that with this loan and with bigger profits, he will be a lot closer to achieving that goal.

loans.use: purchase livestock.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier es un emprendedor que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, se le ha apoyado en brindarle financiamiento para su negocio que es de brindar los servicios de transporte ha mejorado su unidad de transporte. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento pero en este crédito que está solicitando es para realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda lo cual comprara perlines, zinc, cemento, arena, ladrillo entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier is an entreprenuer who has been working through Fundacion Leon 2000, which has helped him by providing financing for his business. Francisco offers transport services and has used past loans to improve his vehicle. 

Francisco is requesting financing anew, but this time he wishes to make improvements to his home. He needs to buy crossbeams, zinc sheeting, cement, sand, and blocks, among other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy crossbeams, zinc sheeting, cement, sand, and blocks, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Jorge Guido

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 47 años que tiene tres hijos, vive junto a sus padres (Salomón y Maruja de 74 y 71 años respectivamente) en una finca en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Este hombre se dedica a realizar fletes en su camión desde hace 8 años y lo cual aprendió por iniciativa propia. Usualmente lo contratan agricultores y ganaderos de la región para cargar material o animales. La jornada la realiza sólo durante un promedio de 8 horas al día. Su camión tiene un cajón de madera el cual necesita renovar ya que está desgastado por el trabajo pesado que tiene, para esto deberá realizar un crédito y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando. 

Es el primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Jorge y el portal KIVA, la cual ha determinado que este hombre tiene un bajo riesgo en incurrir en morosidad. Su sueño es tener algún día su casa propia y es la meta que se ha propuesto para la cual necesita seguir trabajando duro como hasta hoy.
texts.en:
47-year old Jorge has three children and lives with his parents (Salomón and Maruja aged 74 and 71 respectively) on their farm in San Miguel de Los Bancos, a rural canton in the province of Pichincha, where the capital of Ecuador is also located. One of the main resources of Los Bancos is water since a large number of streams and springs originate there and form several large rivers. The canton is a busy commercial centre and in the main street are hotels, restaurants, and above all stores selling farming supplies, as well veterinary services and shops selling daily necessities.

Jorge has earned his living for the past eight years renting out his truck. Usually local farmers and ranchers use it to transport supplies or animals. His working day is eight hours long on average, and he works alone. The back of his truck is made of wood and is in a bad state of repair from all the heavy loads. Jorge needs a loan to pay for the repairs so that he can continue in this line of work.

This will be his first loan with Fundación Alternativa, Kiva's local partner. The institution has determined that Jorge is unlikely to have problems repaying the loan. His dream is to have his own house one day and this is what has motivated him to work hard all his life.

loans.use: to repair the back of his truck

loans.name: Aida Lucia

texts.es: Aida de 22 años vive (isla Guayaquil ). Ella empezó a trabajar en la tienda de su hermano e incremento la tienda en viveres por la necesidad del sector . trabaja todos los días con su hermano es soltera. A futuro anhela tener su propio negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( bebidas, enlatados, granos)
texts.en: Aida, 22, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  She started working in her brother’s store and enlarged the grocery store because of need in the sector.  She works every day with her brother; she’s single.  In the future she hopes to have her own business.  She will use the loan to buy soft-drinks, canned goods and grains

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, canned goods and grains.

loans.name: Gricelda Elizabeth

texts.es: Gricelda de 30 años vive ( duran Guayaquil ) . ella decidió entrar a este negocio por el motivo de que quería darle una mejor  vida económica a su familia . se dedica  a la ventas de almuerzo todos los días trabaja con la ayuda de su hija . ala dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia a futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio  . con el préstamo comprara (granos, carnes, aliños).
texts.en: Gricelda, 30, lives in Durán, Guayaquil.  She decided to go into this business because she wanted to give her family a better economic life.   She sells lunches every day and works with help from a daughter.  The difficulty she faces is crime.  In the future she’d like to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy grains, meats and seasonings.

loans.use: to buy grains, meats and seasoning.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som, 44, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband has been involved in growing rice and renting sound equipment for over three years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed; one is a driver and another one is a teacher. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Som is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family.
 
In the future, she would like to run a pig farm and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José Alejandro se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de venta de productos de  en general como Útiles escolares, juguetes, plásticos, detergentes, maquinas de afeitar, candados etc. El vende estos productos de manera ambulante en su vehículo en las afueras de una escuela. Manifiesta que este negocio lo inicio con poco capital y poco a poco vio que sus ventas aumentaban favorablemente y sus ganancias eran rentables. El trabaja desde las 9.00 am hasta las 6.00 pm.
El solicito un préstamo con ODEF por la cantidad de 7,500 lempiras para poder surtir de útiles escolares y otra parte para reparación de su vehículo ya que esta es la herramienta de trabajo con la que el cuenta para trasportarse a vender su mercadería.
Su sueño es en un futuro llegar a tener su propio local , y que sus hijos se puedan graduar en la universidad.
texts.en:
José Alejandro has been selling general merchandise like school supplies, toys, plastics, detergents, electric shavers, padlocks, etc. for two years.  He sells them in an ambulatory manner in his vehicle outside a school.  He states that he started the business with little capital and little by little his sales have increased favorably and his profits are profitable.  He works from 9am until 6pm.

He asked ODEF for a 7500 lempira loan to stock up on school supplies and use part of it to repair his truck which is the work tool he counts on to transport his merchandise.  His dream for the future is to have his own fixed locale and that his children are able to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to resell and to repair his truck.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Doña Karla, originaria de León  es dueña de una tienda en donde vende ropa nueva el negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación tiene 3 hijos todos van a la escuela este es su segundo crédito Kiva  el cual solicito  para comprar chinela y ropa estilo veranero. Desde que utilizo su primer crédito ha experimentado un cambio positivo en  su negocio  pues ha incrementado su inventario y actualmente vende más, les da las gracias por el apoyo recibido para lograr uno de sus sueños.
texts.en: Karla is a native of León. She owns a store located in her home selling new clothing. She has three children who attend school. This will be her second loan with Kiva and she will use it to buy flip flops and summer clothing. Her first loan resulted in a positive change in her business--she increased her inventory and experienced more sales. She is grateful for the support she has received to fulfill one of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy flip flops and summer clothing

loans.name: Carmen Viviana

texts.es: Carmen de 40 años vive ( duran Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque le gusta el comercio . comenso vendiendo poco a poco fue creciendo y se puso su bazar . trabaja gtodos los días sola tiene 3 hijos es casada su esposo es vigilante de transito. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia . a  futuro ella anhela mejorar sun negocio y tener u  local . con el presatmo comprara ( plumas, cuadernos, papeleria ).
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and lives in Duran, Guayaquil. She decided to enter into this business because she likes commerce. Carmen began selling little by little and business grew. She was able to open her own shop. Carmen works alone every day and the main problem she has is dilenquency. 

Carmen is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a transit guard. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and open a larger store. 

With this loan, she will buy pens, notebooks and paper products to sell.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and pens to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa Cecilia

texts.es: Ninfa de 33 años vive ( duran ecuador ) . ella decidió entrar a este negocio ya que tenían una baja situación económica en su hogar . entonces tomo la decicion de ayudar en los gastos del  hogar entrando a la venta de chifles  . trabaja  todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo tiene 2 hijos y es casada . a futuro anhela tener un local con la venta de chifles . con el préstamo comprara ( cocina ).
texts.en:
Ninfa is 33 years old, and she is from Duran, Ecuador.  She decided to get into this business because she had a poor financial situation at home.  So she made the decision to help with the household expenses and started selling plantain chips.  She works every day, and her husband helps her.  

She is married and has two children.  In the future would like to have a place where she could sell the plantain chips.  She will use the loan to buy a stove.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: Elena de 44 años vive ( playa villamil ). Ella decidió entrara al negocio de la venta de utiles escolares por motivo de que su esposo la abandono .ella necesitaba darle lo necesario a sus hijos y decidió poner un  bazar . le va bien trabaja todos los días sola tiene 2 hijos pequeños .la dificultad que tiene es las calles que cuando llueve se innundan .  a futuro ella anhela arreglar su casa y mejorar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara (utiles escolares, cuadernos ).
texts.en:
44-year old Elena lives in Playa Villamil. She decided to start a business selling school supplies because her husband left her and she needed to support her two small children. She works alone. One of Elena's problems is the rain that causes the streets to flood. 

In the future she wants to do some repairs on her house and improve her business. With the loan money she plans to buy school supplies such as note books.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and notebooks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aquiles Belardino

texts.es: Aquiles de 61 años vive (isla Guayaquil ). El empezó a trabajar se posesiono de este negocio porque se dio cuenta de QUE ESTE NEGOCIO QUE ES LA VENTA DE ROPA es muy bueno . Eso le dio oportunidad de tener mayor ingreso económico. Trabaja todos los días solo es padre soltero  tiene 2 hijos. A futuro anhela ampliar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (ropa ).
texts.en: Aquiles, 61, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  He started to work and took possession of this business because he realized that the business of selling clothes is very good.  This gave him the opportunity to earn higher income.  He works every day by himself. He’s a single father of two children.  In the future he wants to expand the business.  He will use the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gena Dalila

texts.es: Gena de 54 años vive (playa villamil). Ella decidió entrar a esta negocio porque a la vuelta de su casa hay un taller  mecanico donde reparan autos. ella es csada su esposo es pescador no tiene hijos  . trabaja todos los diascon mucho esfuerzo y ganas de lunes a sábado de 7:00 a 5:00 . a futuro anhela mejorara su negocio . con el prestamo  comprara ( aceite, grasas, herramientas).
texts.en:
Gena is 54 years old, and she lives in Playa Villamil.  She decided to get into this business because around the corner from her house there is a mechanic’s shop where they repair autos.

She is married, and her husband is a fisherman.  She does not have children.  She works, with great effort every day, Monday through Saturday  She works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

In the future she wishes to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy oil, grease, and tools.

loans.use: to buy oil, grease, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy at wholesale.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Florita is married and has four children.

To make a living, Florita manages a garden, where she plants a variety of vegetables such as ampalaya (bitter melon). Florita has been in her business for 2 years and earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Florita is requesting a new loan of 5,100 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Sonia es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio De Jicamarca” grupo que está conformado por 10 socios, la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona, la cual llevan 08 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad. Sonia tiene 35 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos, aún dependientes. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que siguió llevando el ejemplo de sus suegros, quienes también se dedicaban a dicha actividad. También ofrece en su vivienda bebidas como gaseosas, agua minera, obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar. Gracias a dichas actividades Sonia ha podido ayudar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos. El deseo de Sonia es de construir su vivienda, ya que solo está construido con material de adobe. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar comida balanceada para sus animales. La Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio De Jicamarca” es un grupo responsable, ellos están agradecidos con el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “San Antonio de Jicamarca” communal bank which has 10 members who are mostly neighbors from the area.  They’ve been working with the Prosperidad Program for 8 months.  

Sonia is 35 years old, married and has three children who are still dependent.  She raises pigs, an activity she took on following her in-laws’ example who also were in that occupation.  She also sells soft-drinks and mineral water at home earning extra household income that way.  

Thanks to these activities Sonia has been able to help her husband cover schooling costs for their children.  Sonia’s wish is to build her house since it’s currently made of adobe.  

She will use the loan she requested to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  The San Antonio de Jicamarca communal bank is a responsible group; they are grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и любит работать. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он откармливает их дома, а затем продает за выгодную цену. Кроме того возле своего дома он имеет арендованный земельный участок около 1 гектара, там выращивает овощи для семейной нужды и корма для скота. Жена помогает по бизнесу. Фуркат запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ USD. Он намерен закупить 3 голов бычков для увлечения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Furkat is married and a responsible father of two children.  He is a very hardworking person and loves to work.  Furkat has been involved in buying and selling cattle for over ten years.  He fattens it up at home and then sells it at an advantageous price.  Besides this, he leases a one-hectare plot of land by his house and grows vegetables there for the family's needs and feed for livestock.  His wife helps him with the business.  Furkat is requesting a loan in the amount of $3000.  He intends to buy three heads of bulls to increase working capital.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Livia Violeta

texts.es:
LIVIA VIOLETA tiene 51 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 25, 22 y 15 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.

LIVIA VIOLETA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, mora, tomate , fréjol,. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de tomate, fréjol, insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes  cada semana.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es pagar el crédito con puntualidad.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar,  realizar minga los días domingos. Y disfrutar de las fiestas de la Virgen de la Inmaculada.
texts.en:
Livia Violeta, 51, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 25, 21 and 15 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

The “Virgen de Baños” communal bank is composed of the Cerritos Mama Sara community.  The members spend most of their time farming, growing corn and raising animals.

Livia Violeta grows corn, blackberries, tomatoes and broad beans.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tomato and broad bean seeds, supplies, manure, fertilizer, urea and insecticide.  She will make her purchases and her sales weekly in Chillanes.

With help from the loan she will be able to improve the crops.  The challenge she faces is to repay the loan punctually.  In her free time she likes to rest, to do communal work on Sundays and to enjoy the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

loans.use: to buy tomato and broad bean seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea and insecticide.

loans.name: Flor Liduvina

texts.es:
Flor Liduvina tiene  54 años  es casada tiene cuatro hijos, vive  con el esposo y con los hijos de 30, 28, 22 y 20 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, los socios se dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de animales.
Flor Liduvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora, tomate. Solicita el crédito para comprar  abonos, fertilizantes, urea, semillas de tomate y mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes  cada semana.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cultivar fréjol, mora, tomate y maíz sin ningún tipo de plagas.  Los desafíos es superar los problemas económicos.
El sueño es poder  ver que los hijos adquieran una profesión, mejorar la producción e incrementar los ingresos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, disfrutar de las fiestas de la Inmaculada concepción.
texts.en:
Flor Liduvina, 54, is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 30, 28, 22 and 20 years old in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

The “Virgen de Baños” communal bank is composed of the Cerritos Mama Sara community.  The members spend most of their time farming, growing corn and raising animals.

Flor Liduvina farms corn, blackberries, tomatoes and broad beans.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tomato and blackberry seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.  She will make her purchases and her sales weekly in Chillanes. With help from the loan she will be able to grow broad beans, blackberries, tomatoes and corn infestation-free.  

The challenge she faces is to overcome economic problems.  Her dream is to see her children attain professional status in the future and to improve and increase income.  In her free time she likes to watch television and to enjoy the feast of the Immaculate Conception.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, urea and tomato and blackberry seeds.

loans.name: Pastor Jesus

texts.es: Pastor de 60 años vive ( Guasmo  Guayaquil ). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner una tienda es de su esposa lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo. tiene hijos menores . La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz)
texts.en: Pastor, 60, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil.  He decided to go into this business because he wanted to help his family’s economic situation.  The idea of opening a store was his wife’s and he did so and is doing well.  He works alone every day.  He has minor children.  The difficulty he has is crime.  In the future he’d like to improve his business and have a locale.  He will use the loan to buy oil and rice.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 30 años vive ( isla Guayaquil  ) el empezó a trabajar en 4 talleres de mecánica y aprendió mucho de carros haciendo mantenimiento . por lo cual decidió entrar a un curso de mecánica y ahora se puso su propio taller y le va bien . trabaja todos los días solo y a veces lo ayuda un primo es soltero . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande . con el préstamo comprara ( piesas mecanicas ).
texts.en: Julio, 30, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  He started working in four auto shops and learned a lot about servicing cars.  Because of this he decided to take an auto mechanics course and now he’s opened his own shop and is doing very well.  He works alone every day and sometimes his cousin helps.  He’s single.  The difficulty he has is crime.  In the future he’d like to enlarge his business.  He will use the loan to buy auto parts.

loans.use: to buy auto parts.

loans.name: Manuela  Antonia

texts.es: Manuela Antonia tiene 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo que está todavía a su cargo y como mucho esfuerzo lo ha sacado adelante. Manuela Antonia trabaja como docente en un colegio de la comunidad, ella tiene una vivienda que su mayor sueño es  acondicionarla y por falta de dinero no las ha realizado. Manuela Antonia está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales y realizar las mejoras a su vivienda lo cual comprara cemento, arena, piedrín, y otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Manuela Antonia, 32, has a son still in her care and with much effort she’s moved him ahead.  Manuela Antonia works as a teacher in a local school.  She has a house and her greatest dream is to fix it up but because of lack of money has been unable to do so.  Manuela Antonia is asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve her house.  She will buy cement, sand, gravel and other building supplies.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery Albertina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery tiene 33 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, Se dedica a la venta de ropa en una zona muy comercial de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rosmery  utilizara  este préstamo de para comprar  mercadería ropa por mayor  para su negocio, la Sra. Rosmery  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que en el lugar  hay mucha competencia de variedad  de mercadería y siempre esta constantemente con retos. Va a utilizar los beneficios incrementara su capital de trabajo,  sueña para su negocio es tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is 33 years old, single, and has no children. She sells clothing in a commercial district in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender and will be used to buy merchandise in bulk for her business. Sra. Rosmery faces challenges in her business since there is plenty of competitors who offer a variety of merchandise, so she must constantly deal with them. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to increase her working capital.

Rosmery dreams of having more customers for her business and improving her income. She feels pleased and is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Mendgul

texts.en:
Mendgul is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in Western Mongolia. Two of her children study in the secondary school. Her husband is the assistant driver of a bus and, in addition, started selling cars in 2010. 

Mendgul makes traditional clothes and souvenir products and trades them. The business has been profitable but they need a specific amount of finance (credit) to develop the business. Mendgul is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity to improve the household and save for my three sons' future. I think this business is being better than previous."  The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy cars for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy cars to sell

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a sanitation company and earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Yun is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a new business selling clothes in the market and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Zoila Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal La Merced, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana ubicada al sureste de Cuenca, es de clima frió y desde su parque central se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales,  a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad.

Doña Zoila tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su camioneta realizando fletes, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.

La Señora Zoila se encuentra muy bien en la salud al igual que todos los miembros que conforman su familia. Ella labora en una panadería hace 15 años y también tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 4 años, actividades que ha elegido para mejorar el bienestar de sus hijos y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito anterior compro productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda, en el pago de dicho crédito no tuvo ningún problema y realizo todos los pagos a la fecha. Esta pidiendo nuevo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su tienda. La banca comunal le gusta ya que los créditos son rápidos y existe un gran compañerismo en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the “La Merced” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish located in southeast Cuenca.  Its climate is cold and from its central park one can view a great part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise animals, farm and many of them have jobs in the city.

Zoila is 33 years old, married and has two children who are 10 and 8 years old and attending the local little elementary school.  Her husband is a driver and works driving his truck making deliveries.  They do not have a house of their own but live in a house belonging to relatives.

Zoila is in very good health as well as the other members of her family.  She has been working in a bakery for 15 years and she also has had a grocery store for the last four years.  She chose these activities to improve her children’s wellbeing and to improve her home’s economy.

With the money from her previous loan she bought basic staple items to stock her store and had no problems repaying the loan; she made all her payments on time.  She’s asking for a new loan to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge her store.  

She likes the communal bank because the loans are quick and there is a great deal of team spirit in the group.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Matias

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 43 años y es divorciado con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 19 años, el se dedica a  la carpintería, el Sr. Juan es carpintero hace varios años, su taller se encuentran en la zona de Cobol,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, Juan utilizara este préstamo para la compra de madera y otros materiales para su negocio ya que tiene mucho trabajo que realizar por esta  razón  solicita este préstamo es por la gran demanda de roperos, Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran competencia  y los  problemas sociales, y  utilizara los beneficios para incrementar su producción de muebles, su deseo para su negocio es tener una carpintería grande con muchos operarios en la cual pueda producir muebles por cantidades, el Sr. Juan es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz por la oportunidad que la institución le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan, 43, is divorced and has a 19 year old son.  He’s a carpenter.  Juan’s has been a carpenter for many years and his workshop is located in the Cobol zone.  

This loan is his third sequence within the institution and Juan will use it to buy lumber and other supplies for his business because he has much work to do and this is why he’s asking for the loan because of the large number of armoires in demand.  

The challenge Juan faces in his business is much competition and societal problems and he will use the benefits to increase furniture production.  His wish is to have a large carpentry shop with many employees that he can manufacture furniture in quantity in.  J

uan is an enterprising person with a strong wish to improve; he feels happy for the opportunity the institution is providing him.

loans.use: to buy lumber and other supplies.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn, 55, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and firewood for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a marriage broker who earns approximately USD 2 per day. Three of her children are employed: two are construction workers and one is a creel (basket) maker. Due to the difficulty of the family’s transportation, Voeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Kha, 34, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business of buying cattle to resell for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His wife runs a souvenir and clothes shop. She earns approximately USD 7 per day. In order to improve his wife’s business, Kha is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell. This loan would enable his wife to have more fashionable clothes to attract more customers and earn more profit. In the future, he would like to use the profits to expand the business and help his children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes to sell

loans.name: Bellavista  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bellavista está formada por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes son personas amables, gentiles y muy trabajadoras, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar  los gastos de sus hogares y salir en adelante con sus familias. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que es de clima frió, está rodeado de vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y comercio, muchos diariamente laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca diferentes ocupaciones. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, tiene 35 años, es divorciada en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 13 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad. 

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a  los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidar de su hija, labora vendiendo leche actividad que la realiza hace 3 años y  de domingo a domingo, también en su casa cría cuyes, pollos, ganado y cerdos.  Se dedica a la agricultura y lo que produce  es solo para consumo de su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra un becerro para seguir creciendo en la cría de animales.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados. 

Las dos niñas de la foto son hijas de dos de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Bellavista” communal bank has one male and six female members who are pleasant, kind, very hardworking people who work at various activities to cover household expenses and get ahead with their children.    They live around Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate surrounded by vegetation.  Its residents raise animals, farm and are merchants.  Many of them go to work every day in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  She’s 35 years old, divorced and has a 13 year old daughter attending a secondary school in the city.  The house she lives in is her property.

Rosa does her household chores and takes care of her daughter.  She has been working selling milk for the last three years from Sunday to Sunday.  She also raises guinea pigs, chickens, cattle and pigs at home.  She also farms but only for home consumption.

She’s in the second loan with the communal bank and she will use it to buy a calf to continue raising animals.  Her goal is to finish her house since it still needs some finishing touches.

The two little girls in the photo are the daughters of two of the members.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Salmun

texts.en:
Salmun, 59 years old, is married to Yohana, a 58-year-old lady. They have eight children between 22 and 33 years old.

Even though Salmun has a job as a teacher, he spends his spare time running a kiosk business in order to generate more income for his family. The business is located about 10 km from his residence. 

Salmun provides corn, tamarind seed, rice, instant noodle, vegetables etc at his kiosk. Salmun is happy for this business, which enables him to finance his four children who are still at the university. Salmun would like to complete his kiosk with more stocks. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of IDR 5,000,000 to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn and tamarind seeds

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: MARIA DE 57 años vive ( Guasmo  Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner una tienda es de su conyugue  lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo. tiene hijos menores . La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite, arroz, bebidas, snacks)
texts.en: At 57 years old, Maria lives in Guasmo Guayaquil.  She decided to enter this business because she wanted to help the financial situation of her family.  The idea of opening a store was her spouse's, and she did so and it is going well.  She works alone every day.  She has young children.  The difficulty she has is crime.  In the future she wishes to improve her business and have a site for it.  With the loan she will buy oil, rice, drinks, and snacks.

loans.use: to buy rice, snacks, and drinks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty  de 50 años  vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y tiene 2  hijos en las edades de 22 y 25 años.  Ella tiene una tienda  donde vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar. Su actividad la inició hace 5 años,  como un pequeño negocio donde vendía pocos artículos, como tubérculos y leguminosas. A ella le empezó a ir muy bien,  porque iniciaron la construcción de 2 urbanizaciones cercanas,  que se convirtieron en su oportunidad empresarial para crecer. En la actualidad planea aumentar el surtido y comprar en mayor volumen y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará abarrotes, tubérculos, refrescos, leguminosas y en general articulo de la canasta familiar, que son los que compra su clientela diariamente, al detalle  para elaborar la comida de su familia. Su meta es fortalecer su buen nombre, ofreciendo un buen servicio, mercancía a precios competitivos y con ello muy seguramente logrará que su negocio sea  cada vez más sostenible.
texts.en:
Betty, 50, lives in the town of Soledad, fifteen minutes from the city of Barranquilla, with her husband; she has two children who are 22 and 25 years old.  She has a store where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, soft-drinks and basic staple items.

She started the business five years ago as a small store selling just a few items like tubers and greens.  She started to do well because two housing projects started to be built nearby and this became her opportunity for business growth.  

She is planning at present to increase her inventory and to buy in larger volume which is precisely the reason why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy groceries, tubers, soft-drinks, greens and basic staple items in general that her customers buy daily at retail to prepare the daily family meals.  

Her goal is to strengthen her good name offering good service and merchandise at competitive prices.  Surely with this she will succeed in making her business more sustainable each time.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed as sanitation workers for over eight years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Thy wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Thy is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase timber for constructing her house. This loan would enable her to have a comfortable house for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build her house

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a truck driver who earns approximately USD 15 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Srey would like to run a new business. Therefore, Srey is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase groceries to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profits to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to repair some parts of her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing, 27, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction foreman for more than three years, earning approximately 10 USD per day. His wife is employed in a massage shop and earns about 3 USD per day. Due to the family's difficulty with transportation, Hing is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable him to use the money saved on transportation expenses for the family's needs. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children get their bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he plans to rebuild his present house to make it convenient for his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, francisco es una persona luchadora ya que se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro para que no le falte nada en su hogar, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Francisco inicio con un primo que fue quien le enseño a trabajar, luego decidió comenzar su propio negocio, el empezó a comprar leche para producir queso, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y desde hace seis años inicio con la descremadora, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita Francisco lo necesita para la compra de leche para elaborar queso. Con este préstamo cambiaria la vida de Francisco en gran manera ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprar la mercadería necesaria para elaborar el producto y así poder ofrecerles mas queso a sus clientes. El único problema que ha tenido fue una vez que lo asaltaron y perdió mucho dinero y eso le afecto en su negocio, ya que se quedo sin capital para trabajar e invertirlo en la producción del queso. Una de sus metas es que su negocio pueda crecer y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. Es su cuarto crédito en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Francisco is 33 years old, married, and has two children. His wife takes care of the household duties. Francisco is a determined individual who works very hard so that his household lacks nothing. His family is very close and works hard. Francisco started working when a cousin taught him this trade. He later decided to start his own business. Francisco began by purchasing milk for producing cheese. His business grew a little bit at a time with the milk separator he acquired when he started six years ago. Francisco works from 6am to 5pm.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy milk for making cheese. This loan will change Francisco's life in a major way since he does not have enough money to buy the necessary supplies for making his product. As a result, he will have more cheese to offer to his customers. The problem he has had to face was being the victim of a robbery in which he lost a great deal of money, which affected his business. Francisco was left without any working capital to invest in cheese production. One of his goals is to grow his business so that he can move his family forward.

This is his fourth loan with FAMA and his previous loans were repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Yerson Enrique

texts.es: Yerson de 37 años vive con su cónyuge y 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 8 años. El tiene un negocio familiar donde elabora rulos de diferentes tamaños en  malla  metálica, oficio del que deriva el sustento de su familia y  que aprendió por tradición,  pues su padre también lo practicaba  y yerson lo ayudaba.
