Now she has applied for this loan to buy a new machine that will make the production easier on her and faster, so she can start making cheese in the future.

loans.use: to buy new machine for making dairy products

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.ru: Шухратчон родился в 1989 году. Его отец работает на Алюминиевом заводе. Его семья очень дружная и он живет с родителем и имеет одну сестренку. Более 2-х лет Шухратчон занимается оптовой купле- продажей куриных яиц. Ему в этом бизнесе помогает друг Акмал. Данный бизнес является его собственностью. Арендует склад не далеко от местного рынка. Шухратчон запрашивает займ для покупки товара (яиц) с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Шухратчон надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Shuhratjon was born in 1989. His father works at an aluminum factory. His family is very friendly and he lives with his parents and has a sister. 

Shuhratjon has been engaged in buying and selling chicken eggs wholesale for more than 2 years. His friend Akmal helps him in this business. He owns this business. The storage he rents is not far from the local market. 

Shuhratjon requests a loan for the purchase of goods (eggs) with an aim to replenish his working capital. Shuhratjon hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.ru:
Жазгул 30 лет, замужем, воспитывает двух детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Жазгул с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 40,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день  в хозяйстве Жазгул имеется  2 дойные коровы, 5 овец,  доходы от продажи молока позволяют покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жазгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует частично вложить в ремонт дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jazgul is 30 years old, married and raising two children. As the primary income of her family, Jazgul has been engaged in livestock breeding since 2000, having started the business with a starting sum of 40,000 som (KGS). Today Jazgul has two dairy cows and 5 sheep at her farm, and the income from selling milk allows her to cover the daily expenses of her family. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Jazgul turned to the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for purchase of additional livestock. Jazgul plans to use the income from the loan partly to repair her house and further to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 28-year-old gentleman who is married with one child. He has been a teacher by profession for the past seven years. 

Patrick would like to educate his children, buy a car and build a permanent home. He is requesting a loan to buy bricks, sand and iron sheets so he can build a toilet for his home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and iron sheets so he can build a toilet for his home.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло житель города Вахдат. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Исматулло имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он водитель. На сегодняшний день Исматулло занимается частным извозом. В этой области он 15 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en:
Ismatullo is a resident of the city Vahdat. He is 55 years old and married. He has two children. His wife stays at home. 

Ismatullo has secondary specialized education. He is a driver by profession. Today Ismatullo is a taxi driver. He has been in this area for 15 years. He takes a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Renzo Luis

texts.es:
Renzo es un joven de 23 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en su moto taxi, el ha luchado mucho para poder adquirirla junto a su esposa, con la que tiene un pequeño de 1 año, al cual ama y está dispuesto a mucho por él.

Renzo a diario tiene que levantarse muy temprano con el fin de poder atender una mayor cantidad de clientes y llevar los ingresos necesarios a su pequeña familia, la cual lo necesita mucho. El nos comenta que piensa que su negocio tiene éxito debido a que siempre ha ofrecido seguridad en el viaje de sus clientes.

Brindándole el apoyo que necesita, Renzo podrá realizar la compra de puertas delanteras y también realizará la renovación de su brevete, el cual ya está por vencerse. El desea que para el otoño todo ya esté listo y así se pueda sentir cómodo y abrigado dentro de su moto taxi. Renzo sueña con poder incrementar sus ingresos y así poco a poco empezar a construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Renzo is 23 years old and he engages in offering public transportation services with his moto taxi*. He has striven a lot in order to be able to buy his vehicle. He lives with his wife and with their young child, aged 1, whom he loves and whom he is ready to do almost everything for.
Renzo has to get up very early every day in order to reach a greater number of customers, thus earning the necessary income to provide for his small family, who strongly needs that. He told us he think his activity is successful because he has always offered a secure mean of transportation to his customers.
By giving him the support he needs, Renzo will be able to buy front doors for his moto taxi, as well as to renew his driver’s license that is about to expire. He wishes everything to be ready by fall, so that he will feel comfortable and sheltered inside his vehicle. Renzo dreams of increasing his income in order to start building his own house one little step at the time.


<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To buy front doors for his moto taxi and to renew his driver's license.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 46-year-old man who lives in Kasese, Uganda.

James has a food market, which he started with capital of 300,000 UGX. This business is now worth 1,200,000 UGX. His hardships are price fluctuations, high transport costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

James' personal goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to diversify and expand his business to new markets. He needs the loan to buy beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old man with seven children. He has a local brewing business, which he has operated for four years. He raised start-up capital by brewing his own bananas from his plantation.

Joseph faces a problem of inadequate capital to facilitate his business. Additionally, customers are not paying on time. 

Joseph would like to build a permanent home and educate his children. He would also like to move his business to a more permanent location and expand it to new markets. He therefore requests a loan to buy more local brew for sale.

loans.use: to buy more local brew for sale.

loans.name: Chimène Nathalie

texts.fr: Chimène Nathalie est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend des pagnes, chaussures dames depuis 1an. Chimène Nathalie s'approvisionne sur le marché extérieur. Ses clients sont essentiellement composés par les femmes et les hommes. Chimène Nathalie veut s'acheter des pagnes, chaussures et tenues. Elle veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et assurer le bien-être de sa famille, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un micro-crédit auprès de Finadev.
texts.en:
Chimène Nathalie is a married mother of two children. She has been selling pagnes and ladies shoes for a year. She buys her merchandise on the foreign market. Her clientele consists of both men and women. 

Chimène Nathalie plans to buy pagnes, clothing and shoes. She wants to provide for her children’s schooling and ensure her family’s well-being, which is why she is seeking a loan from Finadev.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes and 20 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kaly

texts.fr: Monsieur Kaly est un homme de 52 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est  marié  et s’active dans le commerce et la vente de sable et de béton. Il capitalise une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine. C’est  une activité qu’il a choisi par opportunité  dans le but de se procurer des gains financiers. Il  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis juillet 2009 et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’augmentation de son fond de  roulement.  Il compte  se procurer du sable et des bétons a revendre.
texts.en: Mr. Kaly is a 52-year old man who lives in Senegal. He is married, and works as a buyer and seller of sand and concrete. He has 20 years of experience in this field. Mr. Kaly chose this activity as an opportunity to increase his income. He has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since July 2009, and has already benefited from two previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to increase his working capital.  Mr. Kaly plans to buy sand and concrete for re-sale.

loans.use: to buy sand and concrete for re-sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 54-year-old married man, a father with four sons and three daughters.

For the past two years, Mohammad has been running a grocery store, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all his expenses.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a variety of products and groceries for sale such as: rice, milk, sugar, and cooking oil. This will enable Mohammad to offer customers all the types of groceries they often request and buy, which will  increase sales and improve the family's income.

Mohammad's photo was taken inside his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel was photographed inside his store. He is a 36 -year-old married man, a father with one son and two daughters.

For the past two years, Fadel has been running a store for home products sales, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all his expenses.

Fadel is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing home products in bulk that customers usually buy to be used in their different festive occasions especially in the summer season. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a selection of home products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Tugumisirize Saaco Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 42-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has operated a retail business for four years.

Josephine raised start-up capital for her retail business by selling her goat. She says price fluctuations are affecting the business. 

Josephine would like to educate her children and move her business to a more permanent location. She requests a loan to buy sugar, salt and baking powder for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and baking powder for sale.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Agée de 53 ans, Rokia est une veuve qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses 3 enfants, à Koutiala.
Rokia est fonctionnaire de l’Etat en plus de ça elle mène des activités commerciales, notamment  l’achat vente de céréales.
Nantie de 15 ans d’expériences, elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Koutiala et environs.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, Rokia décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 1 tonne de riz dans les casiers rizicoles de Macina auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de sa famille :frais de sanitaire, scolaires , de nourriture,…
texts.en:
53 years of age, Rokia is a widow living in a traditional family with three children, in Koutiala.
Rokia is a governmental employee and in addition she also engages in commerce, specifically in selling cereals.  Thanks to her 15 years of experience in this work, her business is well known and in demand in Koutiala and  nearby.

In the search of additional sources of financing, Rokia decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, and is on her first loan.
This loan will be used to buy one ton [about 2205 lbs] of rice from  farmers at the warehouses in Macina. She sells retail, wholesale, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the market, to a customer base composed of consumers and vendors. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay the loan and provide for family needs: healthcare, education, food etc.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Edwin Santiago

texts.es: Edwin de 29 años, conoció el arte de la marroquinería cuando estudió en la Escuela de Artes y oficios Santo Domingo, (http://www.eaosd.org/  , apoyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) y  desde al año 2009 emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, con las técnicas aprendidas. El tiene un taller de marroquinería, donde fabrica bolsos, correas y billeteras. Genera 3 empleos y tienen como principales clientes, almacenes y mayoristas de Francia, Venezuela y la ciudad de Cali, “llamada también la universidad de la salsa en Colombia, por su pericia para bailar este ritmo”. Edwin con sus diseños exclusivos ha la calidad de sus productos, que tienen un acabado artesanal,  ha ganado mercado y el sostenimiento de este frente a la competencia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas al por mayor y de contado, como cueros y herrajes para aumentar su producción y las ventas, lo cual hace proveer que esta inversión será  todo un éxito. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su  negocio, con equipos de producción, para transformarla en una gran empresa, promocionar sus productos en muchos países y  es con este sueño, que se levanta cada día listo para trabajar.
texts.en:
Edwin, 29, learned the art of leather working when he studied at the Escuela de Artes y Oficios, Santo Domingo (Santo Domingo School of Arts and Crafts) ((http://www.eaosd.org/), sponsored by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. In 2009, he started his own adventure in business, using the techniques he had learned. He has a leather working shop where he makes bags, belts and billfolds. He has three employees and, as principal clients, department stores and wholesalers in France, Venezuela and the city of Cali. Cali is also known as the “University of the Salsa” in Colombia due to the expertise shown in performing the dance..

Edwin’s exclusive designs added to the quality of his products show a craftsmanship that has gained him market share, which he has been able to sustain over the competition. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first funding request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to pay cash for basic materials wholesale, such as leather and hardware, in order to increase his production and sales. This insures that the investment will be a big success. 

Edwin’s future goal is to expand his business with production equipment in order to transform it into a large company and to promote his products in many countries.  It is with this dream that he gets up every day, ready to work.

loans.use: to pay cash for basic supplies wholesale, such as leather and  hardware, in order to increase production and sales.

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi est un homme âgé de 42 ans. Il est marié å une ménagère. Il a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Kossivi travaille comme bijoutier depuis 1990. Il fabrique des bijoux pour tous clients dans son atelier. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille avec 02 personnes. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir pas satisfaire toute sa clientèle.
Kossivi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la matière première pour la fabrication des bijoux. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et épargner pour la réalisation d’autres projets.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossivi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et transmettre son activité à d’autres ouvriers. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossivi is 42 years old. He is married to a homemaker, and the couple have three children aged 3 to 10, two of them in school. 

Kossivi has been working as a jeweller since 1990. In his workshop, he makes jewelry for his customers, and he has two people working with him. He buys his supplies in Lomé. For the time being, his main difficulty is that he is unable to meet customer demand.

Kossivi is seeking a second loan from WAGES to purchase the basic supplies needed to make jewelry. He wants to reinvest in his business and save some money for other projects.

In the coming years, Kossivi would like to expand his business and subcontract some of his work. He plans to use his profits to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry-making supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Victoria

texts.es: Carmen con su credikiva anterior compró materias primas para el empaque de condimentos como canela bicarbonato, clavito, miel de abejas  y uvas pasas., En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente estos productos para hacer el proceso de reempaque y volver a vender y a  aumentar su capital de trabajo.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias  a Kiva y a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, por el apoyo financiero que me han brindado, con estos préstamos, aspiramos a mejorar nuestro nivel de vida a través del aumento en las utilidades del negocio. “
texts.en:
With her last “credikiva” [Kiva loan], Carmen bought primary materials for repacking condiments such as cinnamon bicarbonate, cloves, honey, and raisins. Now, Carmen is requesting a new Kiva loan to purchase these same products anew to re-pack them for retail, hoping to increase her working capital.

Carmen's message to Kiva lenders is as follows: “Many thanks to Kiva and to the Fundacion Mari Santo Domingo for the financial help they have offered me. With these loans we aspire to better our level of life by augmenting business profits.”

loans.use: purchase condiments in bulk and packaging to market them.

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarangerel, 48, is a water specialist and she has a small cattle farm in her home. She lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. They have a son who recently moved out of his parents' house. She has been running her cattle farm since 2005 and currently it has 15 cows in all. 

Her son Mashbayar, 18, studies in high school. He really wants to assist his parents to improve their family's living standard. Recently he purchased a turbine engine car which completely uses natural gas as fuel  to use as a taxi around the city when he is not busy with lessons. He thinks it is a good way to improve his and his family's financial state. Also he believes that the use of a turbine engine /natural gas engine/ car will be environmentally friendly and is a natural oriented idea.  

Last month the car's engine broke down.  Therefore he needs MNT 3,000,000 to purchase a new turbine engine and make some repairs on their green car.

loans.use: To purchase a new turbine engine and make some repairs on their green car.

loans.name: Mbery

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mbery  est âgée  de 41 ans et habite au Sénégal. Elle est animatrice d’une radio locale de la place. En meme temps elle exerce une activité de commerce,  de vente de tissus teintés, bijoux et greffage.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans son activité qu’elle a  choisie par opportunité dans le but de se procurer des revenus réguliers. Par conséquent ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis septembre 2004. Elle a déjà remboursé 9 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour honorer une commande de marchandises qu’elle avait effectué.  La rentabilité  de son activité de commerce  depuis le début de ses activités l’aide  a s’équiper en mobilier de maison et aussi  a  subvenir a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Mbery is a 41-year-old woman living in Senegal. She is a host at one of the local radio stations. She also runs a retail business at the same time, where she sells dyed fabrics, jewellery, and hair weaves. She has over five years of experience with her business that she chose as an opportunity to earn a stable income. Consequently, the lucrative aspect of the business is what interests her the most.

She has been a member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC in the village where she lives since September 2004. She has already paid back nine previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 frs to pay for an order of goods that she placed.

The profitability of her retail business from the very beginning has helped her acquire household furniture and also satisfy her own needs as well as those of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to pay for an order of goods

loans.name: Rodolfo Alberto

texts.es:
Rodolfo es un hombre muy trabajador, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 3 añitos al que quiere mucho aunque a veces le saca canas verdes por lo travieso que es, pero lo convence con su ternura y alegría, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, conocida por su riquísimo chupe de camarones, sus hermosas playas y su agricultura en especial por el cultivo de Arroz, considerado uno de los mejores del mundo, asimismo en esta ciudad se practica la pesca artesanal el cual da mucho empleo. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Rodolfo le gusta jugar futbol, con sus vecinos y amigos y también le gusta jugar con su pequeño hijito; también le pide a su esposa que le prepara uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo” Arroz con pato”. 

Cada día Rodolfo se levanta muy temprano para salir a trabajar en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 70 clientes en el día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo precavido cuando conduce por ello los clientes tienen confianza en el.

Rodolfo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar su seguro contra accidentes de tránsito y realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá dar más seguridad a sus clientes y estar más protegido ante cualquier accidente, con ello seguirá trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Darle la mejor educación a su hijo y hacerlo feliz”.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a very hard-working man.  He lives with his wife and the three year old child.  He loves his son very much even though at times "le saca canas verdes" [he gives him green hairs instead of gray hairs] for how mischievous he is.  However, he wins him over with his tenderness and joy.

His house is in the city of Camana. The city is known for its delicious shrimp chowder, its beautiful beaches, and for its agriculture.  It is especially known for it rice crops, which are considered to be one of the best in the world.  In this city fisherman engage in non-industrial fishing, which provides a lot of employment.

In his free time Rodolfo likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also likes to play with his young son.  In addition, he asks his wife to make one of his favorite dishes, rice with duck, which is delicious.

Rodolfo gets up very early every day in order to leave for work in his business as a taxi driver.  He works around 12 hours a day, and he can provide service to about 70 customers a day.  He believes that the business is going well for him because he is friendly.  Most importantly, he is cautious when he drives.  That is why his customers have confidence in him.

Rodolfo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the great support they have given him, he will be able to buy insurance for traffic accidents.  He will also be able to provide general maintenance to his vehicle.  This will allow him to make his customers safer and better protected during an accident.  He will continue working this way from day to day to make his big dream a reality.  His dream is to give his child the best education and to make him happy.

loans.use: to buy accident insurance and to provide maintenance to his vehicle.

loans.name: Gülay's Group

texts.en:
Gülay is a 40-year-old divorced woman who has 2 children. Following an unsuccessful marriage, she had to take care of herself and the 2 little ones without any support from her family. After many unsuccessful attempts to land a job, Gülay decided to start her own business. She started her venture with a very small budget. Initially, she bought her goods from local wholesalers in Eskisehir because her operations were small and she did not have the resources to buy from other cities with lower prices. 

She has sharpened her business skills over time, and she believes that commitment and persistence are keys to success. Her numerous attempts to rent a space at the local market allowed her to expand her business, and she even bought a vehicle and learned how to drive to transport her goods between local markets. She took care of her children with the income from her business. 

Gülay is a hardworking self-starter, and an intelligent woman. She uses the funds from Maya to support the capital requirements of her business during low seasons. She is thankful to Maya for the support. Her friends from local markets will also use funds from Maya for their businesses. This is Gulay's first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Gülay ,1972 Eskişehir doğumlu.Zor bir evliliğin ardından hayatına tek başına devam etmek zorunda kalmış ve 2 çocuğu var.Eşiyle ayrıldıktan sonra çalışmak zorunda ve çocuklarına bakmak zorunda olan Gülay Hanım ailesine yük olmayı asla düşünmemiş.Kendi ayaklarının üzerinde durup çocukları için çalışmak zorundaymış çünkü.Yapabileceği bütün iş başvurularını yapmış nerdeyse fakat bir sonuç alamayınca neden kendi işimi kendim yapmıyorum deyip bunu en iyi ticaretle yapabileceğini düşünmüş.O kadar küçük bir rakamla başlamış ki ticarete şu an onun için bu başlangıç rakamı güzel bir anı.Önceleri sadece Eskişehir toptancılarından getirdiği pijama ve iç çamaşırlarını satmaya başlamış çünkü şehir dışına gidip mal almak onun için bir lüksmüş fakat kısa zamanda bu işin ustası olmayı başarmış.İnsan dört elle sarılırsa neler yapamaz diyen Gülay Hanım sonrasında bir semt pazarından yer alabilmek için günlerce uğraşmış ve sonunda onuda başarmış,tezgahlar bir iki derken şu an eskişehir çeşitli pazarlarında tezgahları var ve hatta bu iş için bir araç bile alıp onu kullanmayı öğrenmiş.Çocuklarını yaptığı işle büyüten Gülay Hanım evin hem annesi hem de babası.Çalışkan ,azimli,zeki bir kadın .halen yaptığı işte dönem dönem özellikle kış aylarında satışın azaldığı günlerde ve yazın mal getirmek için sermaya sıkıntısı çektiği dönemlerde maya sayesinde bu sıkıntısını gidererek işini devam ettiriyor.Kendisi gibi pazarcı arkadaşları ile kullandığı maya kredisi için Maya’ya teşekkür ettiğinide özellikle dile getiriyor.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Jet Group

texts.en:
Betül, born in 1978 in Istanbul, is the mother of two. Her husband is a laborer at a factory. While Betül lives a very humble life, she has big dreams that she says she has come closer to reaching after encountering Maya. She began working by doing sales from her own house via catalogues for an undergarments and sleepwear company. After traveling from house to house and gathering a particular group of customers, she formed her own group of salespeople and started to make a profit from their sales. She then applied to Maya with the group she formed from her salespeople and took out a loan, which expanded her sales by bringing in more products. As a result, Betül,expanded her own business, and the group members were able to better support their families. Now Betül has realized another of her dreams, thanks to Maya. After noticing that there was no sewing-supply store in her neighborhood, she opened one of her own, not wanting to miss this opportunity. Now she will continue better doing the work she does both at home and as a shop owner from her shop. This is the group's first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteers

Betül,  1978 İstanbul doğumlu evli 2 çocuk annesi.Eşi bir fabrikada işçi olarak çalışıyor Betül,çok mütevazi bir hayatı var fakat bunun yanında çokta güzel hayalleri .Maya ile tanıştıktan sonra bu hayallerine biraz daha yaklaştığını dile getire Betül işi ile ilgili sarfettiği aşamaları şöyle antalıyor;kendi evinden bir iç çamaşırı ve pijama firmasının ürünlerinin katalog üzerinden satışını yaparak başladı ev ev gezerek işini yapmaya çalışan Betül belli bir kesim müşterisini sağladıktan sonra birde kendi alt üyelerini oluşturdu ve onların satışından da kar yapmaya başladı.Maya’ya başvuru yaptığında ise kendi alt üyeleriyle oluşturduğu grupla kredisini çekti ve daha fazla ürün getirerek satışlarını büyüttü.Betül hem kendi işlerini ilerletti hem de grup üyelerinin böylelikle ailelerine büyük destek oldular,şimdi ise Betül bir hayalini daha Maya sayesinde gerçekleştirdi.Kendisine ait bir tuhafiye dükkanı açan Betül Hanım oturduğu semte bu tür bir iş yeri olmadığını farkedince bu fırsatı kaçırmak istemedi şimdi hem bir dükkan sahibi hemde  evden yaptığı işi dükkanınından daha iyi bir şekilde yürütücek.

loans.use: to buy more products and inventory for the sewing-supply store

loans.name: Johnan

texts.en: Johnan, a 32-year-old married father of one, has been operating a produce business for three years. He started by selling his harvested maize, and with the money earned began buying from others. Now requesting a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell, Johnan says price fluctuations and inadequate capital are his major business challenges. His goals are to educate his child and expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase vegetables & fruits in bulk

loans.name: Eumeury

texts.fr:
Monsieur Eumeury est un habitué du guichet car il est à son 6ème prêt .Il est mécanicien et s’active aussi  dans la tôlerie .Il possède son propre atelier  au garage. 
Eumeury est marié et père d’un beau petit garçon de 2 ans. C’est d’ailleurs la raison pour laquelle il sollicite ce crédit. En fait son enfant présente une malformation du cœur depuis le bas âge et il devrait être opéré.
Il a comme charges la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Eumeury is a regular at this branch since he is now on his sixth loan. He's a mechanic and also works with sheet metal. He has his own workshop in his garage.

Eumeury is married and father of a beautiful two-year-old boy. That's actually the reason why he is seeking this loan. His son has had a heart defect since he was very young and needs an operation.

In terms of expenses, he covers his family's everyday expenses and the well-being of his children.

loans.use: to buy prescription drugs and pay the hospital fees for his sick child

loans.name: Mamasodik

texts.ru: Мамасодик проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 45 лет. У него двое детей. Мамасодик предоставляет услугу, он мастер по починке и установке музыкальных инструментов. Кроме того Мамасодик дает в аренду музыкальные инструменты. Этим видом деятельности он занимается девять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения колонок.
texts.en: Mamasodik lives in the town of Vahdat. He is married and 45 years old. He has two children. Masodik provides a service repairing and installing musical instruments. In addition, he rents out instruments. He has been in this business for nine years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy speakers.

loans.use: to buy speakers.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor de 51 años de dad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposa  y  tiene 9 hijos  en las edades de 19 a 34 años.  Desde hace 18 años Néstor inició su vida de negocios, vendiendo patacones con queso, posteriormente implementó la venta de cocteles de camarón, caracoles, chipichipis, chicharrón, pajarilla etc., su negocio ha estado siempre ha girado alrededor de los alimentos y se ha mantenido gracias a la preparación que de estos hace,  y a que como está ubicado en una esquina de su barrio, es muy conocido. Néstor está muy satisfecho con su trabajo, porque con él ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos,  que hoy son mayores de edad y gracias a la Fundación Santo Domingo tiene un historial crediticio,  que inició desde el año pasado  en esta organización. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mariscos, cervezas y refrescos en general, su inversión será exitosa,  porque está bien posicionado y sus productos rotan rápidamente, lo que se convierte en un desafió cuando de ellos  carece. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y sacar  adelante a su último hijo que tiene 19 años en los estudios superiores especialmente.
texts.en:
Nestor is 51 years of age and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and his 9 children, ages 19 to 34. Nestor began his life in business at the age of 18, selling fried bananas with cheese. Later, he began to sell shrimp cocktails, conk, clams, fried pork skins, fried plantain, etc. Nestor's business has always centered on food and he has survived thanks to the manner in which he prepares it. Because he is located on a corner in his barrio, his stall is well known. 

Nestor is very satisfied with his work because it has enabled him to advance his children, who are now adults, and thanks to the Fundacion Santo Domingo, he has established a credit history. He began to work with this organization last year. This 'credikiva' [Kiva loan] will be his 2nd obtained through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. Nestor will use it to buy shellfish, beer, and soft drinks in general. This investment will be successful because he is well positioned and his products turn over rapidly, which becomes a challenge when they disappear. 

Nestor's goal is to expand his business and, especially, to advance his last son, who is 19 years old, with his higher education.

loans.use: purchase shellfish, beer, and soft drinks in general to sell in his stall.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.en:
Mbene is a thirty-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda and practices agriculture. His hardship is unpredictable seasonal weather variations and his personal goals are to build a permanent house and educate his children. He has a business goal of starting other income-generating activities. 

He intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for constructing his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for constructing his house.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 25-year-old businessman who deals in produce, mainly maize and beans, in Kagadi town. He is has three children and has been in this business for a period of two years. 

He started by growing his own crops, then sold them and got capital to start buying from others. Robert faces a problem of price fluctuation and inflation, which erodes most of the profits. His personal dreams are to educate his children and buy a car and his business dream is to expand his business into new markets. Robert wants a loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a 28 year old gentleman married who has 4 children. He has a retail shop, which he has run for a period of 2 years. He got capital from savings of his salary as a civil servant and started a retail shop. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. Obed would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. He wants a loan to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and plastics to sell.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa used the previous loan to buy rice and sugar to sell. The 38-year-old married woman has four children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Kasifa has operated a retail shop for six years. Her hardship is still having inadequate capital to purchase stock. She also suffers from inflation and price fluctuations related to running her business. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to diversify her business. Kasifa is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: El Tabor Group

texts.es:
Alexander, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la aldea Tobar de Intibucá, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad.
Alexander desde pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura junto a su padre y hace 15 años que se independizo, realizando sus propios cultivos de lechuga y brócoli. para poderle dar un mantenimiento y asistencia al cultivo está solicitando un préstamo por 3,000.00 Lempiras, ya es el segundo préstamo obtenido en ODEF y lo va invertir en comprar abono para el cultivo de Lechuga y poder sacar buenas cosechas. Su plan es mejorar la producción para obtener mejores ingresos que cubran los gastos familiares.

El pertenece a un grupo solidario de préstamo que se llama El Tabor y está conformado por 4 miembros en la foto se identifica con camiseta roja a la derecha, seguido esta Raimundo, María Benita y Alba Teresa a la izquierda. Todos viven en la comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de lechuga, coliflor y papas. El total del grupo es de 15,000.00 Lempiras.
texts.en:
Alexander, 31, lives in the village of Tobar in Intibucá with his wife and two children who are 4 and 5 years old.

Since he was little Alexander worked in agriculture helping his father and fifteen years ago became independent installing his own lettuce and broccoli crops.  In order to provide crop maintenance, he’s asking for a 3000 lempira loan.  This is his second loan from ODEF and he’s going to use it to buy manure for the lettuce crops to be able to reap good harvest.  His plan is to improve production to earn better income sufficient to cover family expenses.

He belongs to a communal bank called “El Tabor” that has four members.  In the photo he’s on the right wearing the red shirt.  Nest to him is Raimundo, María Benita and Alba Teresa is on the left.  They all live in the community and grow lettuce, cauliflower and potatoes.  The total group loan is for 15000 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy manure for his lettuce crops.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 32 years old, married to Wilfred, and they have one child. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is Agnes' first loan with Kadet. She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale in her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a large retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old and single. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past 11 years.

This is her first loan with Kadet, KES 30,000. She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan funds to purchase stock of clothes for resale. Her hope is to operate her business in a permanent premise.

loans.use: to purchase stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 39 years old, married to Anita and they have four children. He is a scrap metal dealer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan with Kadet Ltd. He was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase more scrap metal for stock in his business. His hopes are to venture into rental houses business.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Daira Susana

texts.es: Daira de 41 años de edad tiene un negocio de variedades, el cual inició porque no tenía una fuente de empleo y como mujer cabeza de familia, debía ocuparse de su hija en lo relacionado a su bienestar y prosperidad. En su negocio vende productos variados,  como calzado, ropa femenina, chancletas, accesorios para el hogar, en las modalidades  contado y crédito. Daira  también está vinculada a una empresa, de la  cual recibe una guía especializada para la promoción  y venta de sus productos.  Su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo y ha logrado con él,  sacar adelante a su hija, con quien  sueña verla convertida en una persona exitosa. En la actualidad ha recibido 7 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con  ellos ha logrado hacer sus compras en mayor volumen,  mejorar su vida económica, obteniendo recursos de sus ganancias,  para educar a su hija. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el que comprará  mercancía que viene con descuentos en su catálogo y accesorios femeninos y ropa,  directamente a proveedores varios. Su mayor sueño es tener un amplio local donde hacer su buena oferta y su mayor desafió es capitalizar su microempresa, para  que su negocio crezca mucho mas, tal y  como ella lo sueña.
texts.en:
Daira, 41, has a business selling miscellaneous items that she started because she did not have a source of employment and as a female head of household had to see to her daughter’s wellbeing and prosperity.  She sells a variety of items in her business like shoes, women’s clothing, sandals, items for the home.  She sells both for cash and on credit.  She’s also associated with a firm that she gets specialized sales catalogues from to sell their products.  Her business has been growing bit by bit and she’s managed to move her daughter forward thanks to it; she dreams with seeing her become a successful person.

To date she has received 7 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’s used to buy in greater volume and to improve her economic life gaining benefits from her profits to educate her daughter. She is applying now for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy merchandise from her catalogue that’s discounted as well as women’s accessories and clothes directly from her suppliers.  Her greatest dream is to have a spacious locale where she can have good sales and her greatest challenge is capitalizing her micro business so that it will grow much more just like in her dreams

loans.use: to buy merchandise, women's accessories and clothes.

loans.name: Salifu S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kabala town. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 8,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Salifu is the leader of this group of teachers. Salifu was born in Falaba, a village near Kabala town. He is forty-eight years old and married to a businesswoman. Salifu has three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. He has been a teacher for twenty-five years. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Andrew A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a secondary school in Kabala town. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 7,000,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standards of living. 

29-year-old Andrew is the leader of this group of teachers. Andrew was born in a place called Hafip. He is single and has one child who is attending primary school. Andrew is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for four years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials (bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc.) for the construction of a family house. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they otherwise would not have been able to accomplish with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: Pedro  de 22 años de edad es un tecnólogo de administración logística portuaria , que estando desempleado hace un año, con el apoyo de su familia decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios para darle curso a sus deseo de generar sus propios ingresos y  ser independiente. Así buen como ubicó una sala de internet, donde presta este servicio, además de transcripciones, telefonia y de comercializar papelería y útiles escolares inició. Lo primero que tuvo en cuenta fue el tipo de negocio y por eso recurrió a una actividad que llamara su atención,  también tomó en cuenta  su entorno, para identificar un potencial que requiriera de estos servicios  y justamente se encuentra al lado de un colegio de primaria y de bachillerato. Hoy sus  principales clientes son sus vecinos, estudiantes, profesores y le ha ido muy bien, porque ahora cuenta con el apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde está aplicando  a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará 4monitores de computador de escritorio, porque quiere hacer de sus instalaciones un ambiente confortable y seguro,  que cautive y fidelice a sus clientes, pues los que actualmente son obsoletos, con una resolución baja que atenta contra la visión.
texts.en:
Pedro is 22 years old and he is a port logistic administration technologist. Having been unemployed for a year, he decided - with his family's support - to embark on his own business venture in order to channel his desire to generate his own income and be independent.
He set up an Internet cafe, where he offers Internet service, as well as transcription and phone services. He also sells stationery and school supplies.
The first thing he considered was the type of business, and that is why he turned to an occupation which interested him. He also took into account his environment, in order to identify potential in services that were needed. In fact, he is situated next to an elementary school and a high school. Today his main clients are neighbors, students, and teachers. 
Things have gone very well, because he now counts on support from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where he is requesting a Kiva loan. It is his first financing, and he will use it to purchase four monitors for his desktop computers. He wants to make his business place a comfortable and safe environment, that may captivate customers and cultivate their loyalty. His current monitors are obsolete and have low resolution, which can be harmful for the eyes.

loans.use: to purchase 4 desktop computer monitors

loans.name: Norma Isaber

texts.es: Norma de 61 años vende productos mediante guías especializadas. Ella tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad y trabajaba en una empresa, pero  una vez enfrentó la muerte de otro de ellos, sacó todas sus fuerzas para apoyar la educación de sus nietos y por eso inició su negocio. Con sus ventas dejó de ser empleada y ha sido tan importante su trabajo que se ha convertido en la vendedora Número 1 de la Costa Atlántico. Su experticia en su negocio la ha llevado a incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha acudido a créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha tenido  5 financiamientos con los que ha logrado una gran satisfacción, por el apoyo que ha podido dar a su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará cosméticos que tiene encargados y mercancía variada para surtir su negocio. Su inversión será exitosa porque comprará los artículos en descuentos que traen sus catálogos y obtendrá mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Norma, 61, sells products via specialized catalogues.  She has two adult children and she used to work for a firm but once had to confront the death of one of them.  She gathered all her strength to support her grandchildren’s education and this is why she started her business.  

With her sales she was able to stop being an employee and her work has been so important that she’s become the Number One Saleswoman on the Atlantic coast.  Her experience in business has brought her increased sales and this is why she has called on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loans, an organization she’s had five loans with that brought her much satisfaction because of the support she’s been able to give her family.  

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan that she will use to buy cosmetics she has pending orders for and assorted merchandise to stock her business.  Her investment will be successful because she will buy items that are on discount in her catalogues thus obtaining higher profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and assorted merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Lizeida

texts.es: Lizeida de 52 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 32 años. Ella es la propietaria de un restaurante que inició hace 2 años con un pequeño capital que reunió con dinero de sus hijos y al que puso su ímpetu de trabajo, para hacerlo  crecer poco a poco. Hoy vende 80 almuerzos diariamente y proyecta suministrar 60 mas, que le ha solicitado  una empresa,  que se los  pagará a crédito mensualmente. Su meta es lograr tener un capital de trabajo suficiente,  para comprar en mayores cantidades y tener materias primas e insumos disponibles,  para preparar  lo proyectado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas,  como aceite, arroz, tubérculos, legumbres, con los cuales espera responder su nuevo pedido y ganar descuentos por compras en volumen y de contado. Esta es  justamente lo que hará que su inversión tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Lizeida, 52, lives in the city of Cartagena and has four children whose ages range between 26 and 32 years.  She owns a restaurant she started two years ago with a small amount of capital she was able to gather from her children; she put much drive into her work to make it grow little by little.  

Today, she sells 80 lunches daily and is projecting to grow by 60 more that a certain firm has requested from her and that she provides on credit payable monthly.  Her goal is to have sufficient working capital to buy larger amounts of raw materials and have supplies on hand to prepare the projected extra meals.  

This is precisely the reason for calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy raw materials like oil, rice, tubers and vegetables to be able to respond to the new order and earn discounts for buying in large amounts and for paying cash and this is precisely what will make her investment be successful.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like oil, rice, tubers and vegetables.

loans.name: Abu B's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 5,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in businesses, buy pieces of furniture, buy a plot of land, etc. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Abu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 58-year-old is a native of the village of Yisiaia Diang. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Abu has served in the teaching profession for 35 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Con su credikiva Narcisa compró Kits de aseo y productos de belleza que vendió y aumentó ligeramente su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva nuevo, con el cual comprará accesorios para celulares , pues desea agregar nuevos productos, por los que le han preguntado y ella no los tiene. Su credikiva se postula como exitoso, porque atenderá una demanda diversificando su oferta ea aumentando sus utilidades. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: Gracias por apoyarme, que el señor les abra las puertas, para que puedan seguir apoyando a microempresarios como yo"
texts.en: Narcisa used her Kiva loan to buy cleaning kits and beauty products that she sold slightly increasing her working capital.  She’s now applying for a new Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy mobile phone accessories because she wants to add new products that she’s had requests for and she does not stock.  Her Kiva loan is potentially successful because she will respond to demand diversifying her offer and increasing her profits.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you for supporting me.  May the Lord open doors so that you can continue supporting micro businesswomen like me.”

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ingrid Del Rosario

texts.es: Ingrid con su anterior credikiva compró mercancia variada como útiles escolares, productos de belleza y ropa para niños. Con su inversión está satisfecha y ahora está aplicando a un nuevo cedikiva con el cual comprará las líneas de productos que comercializa actualmente como papelería, cosméticos, ropa infantil y tambien productos de farmacia pues ellos tienen una gran demanda en el sector. Su mensaje a los finacaidores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Gracias por darme la oportunidad de progresar y sacar adelante a mi familia. "
texts.en: Ingrid used her last Kiva loan to buy assorted merchandise like school supplies, beauty products and children’s clothes.  She’s satisfied with her investment and is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy product lines she currently sells like stationery supplies, cosmetics, children’s clothes and also pharmacy items because they are in great demand in her sector.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thanks for giving me the opportunity to make progress and to move my family forward.”

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, cosmetics, children's clothes and pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es: Dolores de 42 años de edad  vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 6 años. Ella se dedica a las tareas artesanales, las cuales aprendió por tradición  familiar, de su madre quien es experta en el tejido en telar vertical. Por eso desde muy joven las conocía perfectamente y cuando organizó su familia,  se dedicó a ellas. Posteriormente  empezó a vender cervezas hace muchos años en el mes de Diciembre  y como le fue muy bien la adicionó a sus ingresos, mientras su esposo también lo hace,  prestando el servicio de transporte a la ciudad de Cartagena. Su meta es ampliar sus negocios y también tener su propia casa. En la actualidad su mayor desafió es que ante las expectativas de inversión, su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para hacer todo lo que planea. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará hilos, hilazas, y bebidas para vender los fines de semanas, para continuar fortaleciendo el ingreso familiar. Su inversión proyecta  ser exitosa porque con ella fabricará bolsos, mochilas y hamacas que tiene encargadas y también aumentará la posibilidad de vender cada vez más cervezas.
texts.en:
Dolores, 42, lives with her spouse and two children who are 2 and 6 years old.  She does crafts that she learned as a family tradition since her mother is an expert on the vertical loom.  Because of this since very young she’s known them perfectly and when she formed her own family she went into it.  Later on she started to sell beer many years ago during the month of December and since she did very well added this to her income; her husband contributes too working providing transportation service in the city of Cartagena.  

Her goal is to expand her business and also to have a house of her own.  Her greatest challenge is that in face of investment expectation, her working capital is insufficient to do everything she plans and this is the reason why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy thread, yarn and also beverages to sell on the weekend to continue strengthening family income.  Her investment is potentially successful because with it she will manufacture purses, backpacks and hammocks that she has pending orders for and will also increase the possibility of selling more beer each time.

loans.use: to buy thread and yarn to make hammocks and purses and to buy soft-drinks to sell on the weekend.

loans.name: Musa P.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan. These loans help these teachers and their counterparts within Kabala and SMT's other operational areas to solve certain financial challenges that their salaries alone cannot solve. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

The leader of this group is Musa. Musa is a native of Timbako village, in northern Sierra Leone. The sixty-two-year-old is married and has five children – one in primary school, three in secondary school and one in college. Musa has been a teacher for twelve years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and will use the rest to buy house building materials.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy house building materials
